metadata.Title: CVE-2016-2217 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
The OpenSSL address implementation in Socat 1.7.3.0 and 2.0.0-b8 does notuse a prime number for the DH, which makes it easier for remote attackersto obtain the shared secret.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2217` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

socat - 1.7.2.3-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: socat package in trusty/esm, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.7.2.3-1').
